definition: (TCM) observation, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards

sentences.english: Diagnosis can be made by observing, pressing and measuring the electrical resistance on the auricular points.
sentences.chinese: 通過對耳穴的望診，壓診，電測等還可用於診斷疾病。

definition: (TCM) pulse feeling and palpitation, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]
(TCM) diagnosis based on the patient's pulse/to make such a diagnosis
body palpation (diagnostic method in TCM)/tactile examination

(TCM) the four methods of diagnosis, namely 望診|望诊[wang4 zhen3] (observation), 聞診|闻诊[wen2 zhen3] (auscultation and olfaction), 問診|问诊[wen4 zhen3] (interrogation), 切診|切诊[qie4 zhen3] (pulse feeling and palpation)
going with nature and the seasons (TCM)
lit. the disease is cured the moment the medicine is taken (idiom)/fig. (of a medical treatment) to give instant results/(of a solution or method) highly effective
to feel the pulse (TCM)/Taiwan pr. [zhen3 mo4]
interpretation of the cause/onset and process of an illness/pathogenesis
